page.title: 14CHILBOLTON COMMON
page.content: KNOWN AS COW COMMON,THIS AREA IS OWNED BY THE PARISH COUNCIL WHO BOUGHT IT FROM THE CHURCH COMMISSIONERS IN 1954 FOR Â£50. ABOUT 48 ACRES IT IS USED WIDELY BYLOCALS AND VISITORS ALIKE. IT IS ONE OF THE RICHEST AREAS OF DAMP MEADOW IN SOUTH ENGLAND,AND IS A PROPOSED S.S.S.I. OF GREAT INTEREST FOR ITS NUMBER AND VARIETY OF PLANTS;- 4 SPECIES OF ORCHID AND 13 SEDGES HAVE BEEN FOUND. BUTTERFLIES AND BIRDS ARE ABUNDANT,PARTICULARLY SNIPE,LAPWING REDSHANK AND HERON. THE COMMON CONTAINS THE RIVER TEST WHICH IS THE BEST STRETCH FOR TROUT FISHING. WHEN MORE FISHERMEN CAME TO THE RIVER THE NATIVE BROWN TROUT BEGAN TO DECREASE RAPIDLY. NOW RAINBOW TROUT ARE REARED IN FISH FARMS NEARBY AND PUT INTO THE RIVER WHERE THEY CO-HABIT WELL ITH THE BROWN TROUT,KEEPING THE FISH STOCK HIGH.OPEN FISHING IS NOT ALLOWED.
